contextId.information: God's grace is spoken of as if it were a thing that could be changed into something horrible. AT: "who change the grace of our God into filthy lust" or "who teach that God's grace permits one to continue to live in sexual sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: who pervert the grace of our God into sensuality

contextId.information: This metaphor says that their sin makes their bodies—that is, their actions—unacceptable the way garbage in a stream makes the water undrinkable. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Reefs are large rocks that are very close to the surface of water in the sea. Because sailors cannot see them, they are very dangerous. Ships can easily be destroyed if they hit these rocks. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is a metaphor for a life that pleases God and helps other people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Like trees that have been completely pulled out of the ground by their roots, the ungodly people have been separated from God who is the source of life. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

As wind causes wild waves to stir up dirty foam - so these men, through their false teaching and actions, shame themselves. AT: "just as waves bring up foam and dirt, these men pollute others with their shame" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

These people are spoken of as if their desires were kings who ruled over them. AT: "are never able to stop dishonoring God by doing the evil things they wish to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: will follow their own ungodly desires

contextId.information: think as other ungodly people think; they value the things that unbelievers value (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

This is doing for others whatever needs to be done to keep them from dying without Christ and gives a picture of someone  pulling out people who fall into a fire before they burn. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: snatching them out of the fire

contextId.information: His glory is brilliant light that represents his greatness. AT: "and to allow you to enjoy and worship his glory" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: to cause you to stand before his glorious presence
